properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Sharks at Accor Stadium. Kick-off at 8pm, full time around 9.45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as footy fans travel to the precinct during the busy Friday night peak.

Motorists should extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd. 

Fans should consider catching public transport or parking at a nearby station commuter carpark to connect with trains to Olympic Park to avoid traffic delays.

Fans who must drive should, carpool and pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. Avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout and use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access car parks.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
McKell Cup Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race from 4:25pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on stadium shuttle buses. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Eels at McDonald Jones Stadium. Jersey Flegg from 1.15pm and NSW Cup from 3pm. NRL kick-off at 5.30pm, full-time around 7.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Dragons v Dolphins at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. NRL kick-off at 2pm, full time around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of match start including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Cowboys at BlueBet Stadium. Preliminary match at 2pm, NRL kick-off at 4.05pm, full time approx. 6.05pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as thousands of fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Wests Tigers at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 6:15pm, full time around 8.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the game.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd.  
  • Due to the Moore Park Road pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Road onto Moore Park Road westbound. Motorists can use Cook Road for access onto Moore Park Road instead.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 10pm on sections of Lang Road, Fitzroy Street, Moore Park Road, Albion Street, Cleveland Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to and from the event.

AFL: Sydney Swans v Fremantle Dockers at the SCG. First bounce at 1.45pm, full time around 4.25pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match.

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the game as delays are expected. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 10.45am and will reopen after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. Car parks open from 10.45am.
  • Due to the Moore Park Rd pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Rd onto Moore Park Rd westbound. Motorists can use Cook Rd for access onto Moore Park Rd instead.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas between 11am and 6pm including sections of Lang Rd, Oxford St, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Harlem Globetrotters at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts at 2pm, finish around 3.45pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

NRL: Roosters v Dragons at Allianz Stadium. Gates open at 11.15am and NSW Cup kick-off from 11.30am. NRL kick-off at 2pm, full time around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the game.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 10.15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. EP2 car park will not be open for this match.
  • Due to the Moore Park Road pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Rd onto Moore Park Rd westbound. Motorists can use Cook Rd for access onto Moore Park Rd instead.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am to 6pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Member Appreciation Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race at 4.25pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads, and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

properties.otherAdvice:
Wests Tigers v Storm at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off from 5.30pm and full time around 7.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James St, Perry St, Balmain Rd, Mary St and Glover St as attendees travel to and from the event.

A section of Mary St will close before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area. Traffic will be detoured via Chapel St while the closure is in place.   

Motorists requiring to access other venues in the area should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as footy fans travel to the precinct.

Motorists should add extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd. 

Fans should consider catching public transport or parking at a nearby station commuter carpark to connect with trains to Olympic Park to avoid traffic delays.

Fans who must drive should carpool with their group and pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. Avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout and use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access car parks.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

International Rugby: Wallabies v Wales at Allianz Stadium. Woollaroos v Fiji kick-off 4.45pm. Wallabies v Wales kick-off at 7.45pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads around Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. Car parks open from 4.45pm.
  • Due to the Moore Park Road pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Rd onto Moore Park Rd westbound. Motorists can use Cook Rd for access onto Moore Park Rd instead.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 7,000 people will take part in the annual Sydney Harbour 10k and 5k on Sunday 28 July.

Events start from George St in The Rocks from 7:30am. The course travels around the harbour foreshore using on and off-road pathways via Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo, King St Wharf , Darling Harbour and Pyrmont. To safely facilitate the event, road closures will be in place.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 4am to 1pm: Circular Quay West at the OPT
  • 4:30am to 11am: George St from Alfred St to Hickson Rd, Hickson Rd from George St to Park Hyatt, and the OPT Upper Roadway
  • 6am to 10am: Hickson Rd between Napoleon St and Barton St, Sussex St between Napoleon St and Erskine St, northbound lanes of Sussex St from King St to Erskine St, Slip St and Barton St.
  • 6am to 11am: Hickson Rd from Park Hyatt to Barton St, and Napoleon St. Sections of Dalgety St and Towns Pl.
  • 7.30am to 10am: Sections of Murray St & Pirrama Rd, and Wharf 7/10 Service Rd in Pyrmont.
  • 8.30am to 9:30am: Barangaroo Ave, Cuthbert St, Erskine St, King St, Lime St, Shelley St and Watermans Quay at King St Wharf.

Changed local access arrangements will be in place around King Street Wharf/Barangaroo between 8:30am and 9:15am and in Pyrmont between 7:30am and 10am. There will be no exit from the King Street Wharf area between 8:30am and 9:15am due to the closure of Sussex St. Access in via Harbour St/Wheat Rd.

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY CBD / THE ROCKS 

4:30AM TO 11AM

  • George Street between Alfred Street and Hickson Road 
  • Hickson Road between George St and Park Hyatt
  • Upper Roadway from Hickson Road to Overseas Passenger Terminal

THE ROCKS

FROM 4AM TO 1PM

  • Circular Quay West from Argyle Street

FROM 6AM TO 11AM

  • Dalgety Road between Windmill Street and Towns Place
  •  Hickson Road between Barton St and Park Hyatt
  • Towns Place between Dalgety Road and Hickson Road
  • Napoleon Street between Kent Street and Sussex Street

BARANGAROO / DAWES POINT / MILLERS POINT    

FROM 6AM TO 10AM

  • Hickson Road between Napoleon Street and Barton Street
  • Slip Street from Sussex Street
  • Sussex Street between Napoleon Street and Erskine Street
  • Sussex Street between King Street and Erskine Street (Northbound)
  • Barton St between Barangaroo Avenue and Hickson Road

PYRMONT

FROM 7AM TO 9:30AM

  • Murray Street 1 between Darling Drive and Pirrama Road
  • Pirrama Road 2 between Murray Street and Jones Bay Road
  • Wharf 7 & 10 access road 3 from Pirrama Road

1 No access to or from Australian National Maritime Museum.

2 Exit only from The Star carpark northbound on Pirrama Road. Access to Star Casino via Edward St.

3 Exit only until 8.00am northbound on Pirrama Road.


CYCLEWAY CLOSURE

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 8:30AM TO 9:30AM

  • King St 1 between Kent St and Sussex Street

1. Cycleway detour from Pyrmont Bridge to Kent Street and vice versa via Market Street Road bridge.

 

SHARED PATHWAY CLOSURE

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 8:30AM TO 9:30AM

  • King Street off ramp between Pyrmont Bridge and Sussex Street
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures, Cycle-Way Closure, Shared Pathway Closure

arrangementElements.html:
CHANGED ACCESS ARRANGEMENTS DURING CLOSURE PERIODS:

SYDNEY (BARANGAROO SOUTH AND KING STREET WHARF)

FROM 8:30AM TO 9:30AM

  • Barangaroo Avenue between Lime Street and Barton Street
  • Cuthbert Street between Lime Street and Shelley Street
  • Erskine Street between Lime Street and Sussex Street
  • King Street between Shelley Street and Lime Street
  • Lime Street between King Street and Barangaroo Avenue
  • Shelley Street between Lime Street and King Street
  • Waterman’s Quay between Barangaroo Ave and Hickson Rd

No exit from King Street Wharf area between 8:30am and 9:15am due to closure of Sussex Street. Access via Harbour St / Wheat Rd. No exit during closure times.
